Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2011 04:48PM pinkribbons2 wrote: The 'waiting game' is the worst.  My doc found a 2cm x cm 'suspicious spot' around my mastectomy on 1/7.  I had to wait 12 days for a biopsy (longest 12 days of my life) and then got the good news that it is scar tissue and muscle from the reconstruction surgery.  Please know I'm sending you positive thoughts.  I'm glad you've called your doc and expressed your concern and how anxious you are to get the results.  We have to be our own advocates.  I hope you hear from them before the day is over and I pray it's a good result.  Thoughts and prayers go out to you positivethoughts...by the way, I like your screen name.  Positive thoughts are crucial and get us through some tough times.
Posts.Title: Waiting for test results positivethoughts positivethoughts

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 05:54PM pinkribbons2 wrote: I panic about everything, medical or otherwise.  I am one big bundle of nerves and I drive myself and those around me crazy.  Eight days ago, my oncologist found a 'suspicious spot' on the margin where I had my mastectomy.  I have to wait until this coming Wednesday to get the biopsy.  I've got myself in such a state and can't get out of it.  I was blessed with a beautiful granddaughter 3 days ago, and even this wonderful event hasn't lessened my anxiety.  I'm rambling, I'm a wreck.  But I think you're acting as normal as a cancer patient can be.  I've tried the breathing exercises, but I too hold my breath a lot.  I hope you find some peace and that your anxiety lessens.
Posts.Title: Panic at ANYTHING medical related bookgirl frustratedrg
